content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. KKR 2024 MBA Internship Program - Infrastructure
New York
KKR is seeking current 1st-year MBA students (graduation date: Spring 2025) for our 2024 MBA Internship Program and to be an active part of a team-oriented environment. The internship is 10-weeks in length and will take place in our New York office. Following the conclusion of the internship, 2025 full-time offers may be extended to exceptional performers.
Infrastructure
KKR’s Infrastructure group executes a global private equity investing strategy and operational approach within the infrastructure sector. The majority of the Infrastructure team’s deals are corporate buyouts, but the team has the ability to do joint ventures and minority investments, as well as structured equity deals. The team evaluates investments across infrastructure sub sectors with a focus on digital / internet infrastructure, renewable energy and energy transition, transportation and heavy asset leasing.  Accruing nearly $50bn in AUM since inception a decade, KKR Infrastructure is a dynamic, growing team that benefits from all of KKR’s leading value-add resources.
This individual will be integrally involved with all aspects of the investment process, including: sourcing and evaluating potential investments; performing due diligence; structuring and closing transactions; monitoring performance at portfolio companies; exiting investments; and interacting with management teams and the firm’s investors.
Position Description and Responsibilities

Identifying attractive investment themes and opportunities
Gathering and synthesizing industry and market data
Extensive analysis on potential investments, including in-depth financial modeling in Microsoft Excel
Managing the due diligence process, including overseeing commercial, accounting, tax, and legal diligence advisors
Assisting with the development of and monitoring operational initiatives within portfolio companies
Monitoring and reporting on portfolio company performance
Drafting and presenting oral and written materials to management and investors
Building relationships within the firm and with management teams, as well as with external advisors and industry experts

Primary Qualifications and Skills

Current 1st-year MBA student with anticipated graduation date of Spring 2025
Candidates must embody KKR’s core values, in particular: unquestioned integrity, a strong work ethic, and a commitment to teamwork and excellence.
Ideal candidates will have a genuine enthusiasm and curiosity for investing, a strong understanding of fundamental business analysis, and an outstanding academic record.
Candidates must possess superior analytical and financial modeling skills; a solid grasp of financial concepts; exceptional written, interpersonal, and communication skills; attention to detail; and a maturity that enables them to contribute to a collaborative and constructive work environment.

Application Instructions:

Deadline to apply is December 3rd -- 11:59pm ET
You can submit a maximum of 2 applications
